title: 112_hr1447
content: The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" may be cited as the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established within the Transportation Security Administration to advise on aviation security matters and develop recommendations for improvements. Working groups will develop recommendations approved by the Advisory Committee for transmission to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee, established to advise on aviation security matters, will approve recommendations from working groups for transmission to the Assistant Secretary. Periodic reports on identified matters and an annual report on activities, findings, and recommendations will be submitted to the Assistant Secretary. Membership appointments will be made by the Assistant Secretary within 180 days of enactment. The Advisory Committee on aviation security will consist of up to 27 members representing various organizations in the aviation industry. The Assistant Secretary will appoint members within 180 days of enactment, with representation from air carriers, labor organizations, airport operators, and aviation technology security industry. Members may be removed by the Assistant Secretary if necessary. The Advisory Committee on aviation security, consisting of up to 27 members from the aviation industry, may have members removed for cause by the Assistant Secretary. Members will not receive compensation from the Government and must meet at least semiannually. Additionally, an air cargo security working group will be established within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues. The air cargo security working group will provide recommendations on air cargo security issues, including implementing security programs for screening air cargo on passenger and all-cargo aircraft. The group will meet quarterly, submit recommendations to improve cargo security initiatives, and include members with expertise in air cargo operations. The General Aviation Security Working Group within the Advisory Committee provides recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The group meets quarterly, includes members with expertise in general aviation, and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Assistant Secretary will establish an airport perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on improving perimeter security and access control procedures at airports. The working group will meet quarterly, include members with expertise in airport perimeter security, and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee will include members with expertise in airport perimeter security and access control issues, cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to this committee. Definitions for terms like "Advisory Committee" and "perimeter security" are provided in this section. Perimeter security involves monitoring, securing, and preventing unauthorized access to an airport, including its airfield and terminal. It includes the fence area, access gates, and access controls surrounding the airport. The House of Representatives passed the Aviation Security Advisory Committee bill on June 28, 2012. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
